intro: Triaspis bukombensis, commonly known as the Bukombé spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Cameroon and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is typical of the genus Triaspis. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
